lender.occupational_info: A Chartered Secretary is a member of The Institute of Chartered Secretaries and Administrators (http://www.icsa.org.uk) and is primarily involved in ensuring that his or her employing company meets its legal, compliance and regulatory obligations and that it is managed in accordance with the best standards of corporate governance. The role is also concerned with corporate ethics and social responsibility and has often been described as being that of the "conscience of the company". In practice it's about trying to stop the directors doing anything daft enough to get themselves banged up.

lender.name: Alan
lender.loan_because:
I can visualize a world where everyone has peace, prosperity, education, and health care. I'm grateful for all that I have and wish that others could be as fortunate.
Distribution of global resources is not a 'zero sum game'. One can get a bigger "slice of pie" without taking someone else's piece. The point here is enabling people to fulfill their potential to create real value. There remain vast opportunities for expanding the size of the pie, and I applaud Grameen Bank, MFIs, & Kiva for doing so!
lender.occupational_info:
I am happily married with two wonderful children, a comfortable home, sufficient resources, good health, and good friends.
I have a BSEE degree and am very fortunate to work in my own home designing electronic circuits and systems. Most of my designs are used in instruments sold worldwide to researchers in molecular biology laboratories who use them for beneficial endeavors such as medical research. Other recent designs include motorcycle gauges and a fountain light show.
Like most well-educated & caring people, I've been aware and concerned about pollution, energy, and global warming for decades (in the 70's we called it Greenhouse Effect), and this is a large part of the reason that I have worked from home the past 21 years to avoid excessive gasoline usage.
While I love my country (and my right to criticize its government), I am ashamed of U.S. foreign policy and the Bush 43 administration in particular. (If you can't read radicals like Chomsky, read Senator Byrd's 'Losing America' or Al Gore's 'The Assault on Reason'.) Here we can offset that with positive actions that are easy and feel good ("constructive selfishness").
The American people, like people the world over, are much kinder, nobler, and more peaceful than their government. Kiva is proof of that!

lender.name: Cindy
lender.loan_because: Kiva is the best adventure money can have.
lender.occupational_info: Cat and dog doctor.

lender.name: Laurie & BW
lender.loan_because:
"I wake up in the morning torn between the desire to save the world and to enjoy the world. This makes it hard to plan the day." (E.B. White) But Kiva makes it easier! :-) We enjoy and are often humbled by our little glimpses into so many diverse lives through the stories and photos, and the chance to help through our loans. It really enriches us when we do whatever we can to alleviate suffering and improve the well-being of our fellow humans (and non-humans), so we're grateful for the privilege to partner and share with people in such a personal, meaningful way.
"Nobody made a greater mistake than he who did nothing because he could only do a little." ~Edmund Burke
lender.occupational_info: We live in the mountains with 3 rescued dogs, a horse & many wildlife friends, and enjoy hiking, reading, organic gardening, photography & homebrewing. We strive to live simply & lightly on the earth, applying ahimsa (a Sanskrit word meaning "kindness to all life" or "non-harming") to our lives - and our loans. Our own dream is to live in an off-grid cottage part time & on a sailboat the rest of the time, exploring this beautiful planet & maybe meeting some of our inspiring loan recipients!
